source.573a32fe:
Here's quick summary of the type of our data:

  • Objects: 5 - These are mostly categorical data.
  • Integer: 6
  • Float/Real Numbers: 1

Our dataset doesn't contain any null values as well.

source.64c8df8d:
Few things that are worth to note here are:

  • The minimum value of `Oldpeak` column is a negative number which can be a wrong value.
  • The value of `FastingBS` is mostly `0`. Infact it is `0` for `75%` of records.
  • The difference between `75th` quartile and maximum value of `Cholesterol` attribute has a huge difference which indicates that there are some outliers in it. Same is the case for `Oldpeak` as well.
